comments.author: SosSpagetti
comments.body: Nowadays, a lot of people do all or nothing. When they decide to be fit and start to, e.g., go to the gym, they start a new diet and change their whole lives for this. I see this attitude as being so demotivating. And in short time they will get rid of it and come back to their old habits. I would recommend to all people who would like to be healthy that they slowly change their daily routine. I like the 80/20 rule; for example, when it comes to eating, you don't need to eat 100% healthfully if you want to be fit. Eat something unhealthly from time to time ( or even every day—one cookie). Your mental state is also important. And don't try to change your life the way that it's hard for you. You like to run; great, do it. You don't need to go to the gym or swim. Find your way and take little steps, try to choose better options for yourself. Knowing your choice is important here."Hard choices make easy lives," as someone once said, and "Easy Choices make a Hard Life."
